intro: Vouacapoua pallidior, commonly known as the white-pink velvet tamarind, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody pods containing edible seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in tropical regions. Vouacapoua pallidior thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
